cellularAutomata.util.math
Class Complex

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.util.math.Complex

public class Complex
extends java.lang.Object

Creates a complex number and implements standard complex arithmetic.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

Complex

public Complex(Complex z)
Constructs the complex number from another complex number.

Parameters:
z - The complex number from which this number will be built.

Complex

public Complex(double real,
               double imaginary)
Constructs the complex number z = real + i*imaginary.

Parameters:
real - The real part
imaginary - The imaginary part

Complex

public Complex(java.lang.String z)
        throws ConversionException
Constructs a complex number from a string representation. Throws a ConversionException if the string cannot be converted to a complex number.

Parameters:
z - The complex number written as a string, "u + wi", "u - wi", "-u + wi", "-u - wi", "u", "-u", "wi",or "-wi". Note that the spaces must be exactly as indicated. This spacing is the same as that produced by the toString() method of this class. The values of u and w may contain scientific notation such as 0.37E-5 which must not have any additional spaces (as shown).
Throws:
ConversionException
Method Detail

add

public static Complex add(Complex z,
                          Complex w)
Adds two complex numbers. (x+i*y) + (s+i*t) = (x+s)+i*(y+t).

Parameters:
z - The first complex number to add.
w - The second complex number to add.

complexConjugate

public static Complex complexConjugate(Complex z)
The complex conjugate of the complex number (the conjugate of x+i*y is x-i*y).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
The complex conjugate of z. In other words, z-bar.

cos

public static Complex cos(Complex z)
The cosine of the specified complex number. cos(z) = (exp(i*z)+exp(-i*z))/ 2.

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
cos(z).

cosh

public static Complex cosh(Complex z)
The hyperbolic cosine of the specified complex number. cosh(z) = (exp(z) + exp(-z)) / 2.

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
cosh(z).

divide

public static Complex divide(Complex num,
                             Complex den)
Divides one complex number by another complex number. In other words, (x+i*y)/(s+i*t) = ((x*s+y*t) + i*(y*s-y*t)) / (s^2+t^2)

Parameters:
num - The numerator.
den - The denominator.

exp

public static Complex exp(Complex z)
The complex exponential, exp(z).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
exp(z) where z is the complex number.

log

public static Complex log(Complex z)
Finds the principal branch of the complex logarithm of the specified complex number. The principal branch is the branch with -pi < arg(z) <= pi.

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
log(z) where z is the Complex number.

minus

public static Complex minus(Complex z,
                            Complex w)
Subtracts two complex numbers. (x+i*y) - (s+i*t) = (x-s)+i*(y-t).

Parameters:
z - The first complex number.
w - The second complex number which is subtracted from the first complex number.

multiply

public static Complex multiply(Complex z,
                               Complex w)
Mutiplies two complex numbers. In other words, (x+i*y)*(s+i*t) = ((x*s-y*t), i*(x*t-y*s))

Parameters:
z - The first number to multiply.
w - The second number to multiply.

plus

public static Complex plus(Complex z,
                           Complex w)
Adds two complex numbers. (x+i*y) + (s+i*t) = (x+s)+i*(y+t).

Parameters:
z - The first complex number to add.
w - The second complex number to add.

sin

public static Complex sin(Complex z)
The sine of the specified complex number. sin(z) = (exp(i*z)-exp(-i*z))/(2*i).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
sin(z).

sinh

public static Complex sinh(Complex z)
The hyperbolic sine of the specified complex number. sinh(z) = (exp(z)-exp(-z))/2.

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
sinh(z).

sqrt

public static Complex sqrt(Complex z)
Takes the square root of the specified complex number. Computes the principal branch of the square root, which is the value with 0 <= arg(z) < pi. In other words, computes sqrt(z).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
The square root of z.

subtract

public static Complex subtract(Complex z,
                               Complex w)
Subtracts two complex numbers. (x+i*y) - (s+i*t) = (x-s)+i*(y-t).

Parameters:
z - The first complex number.
w - The second complex number which is subtracted from the first complex number.

tan

public static Complex tan(Complex z)
The tangent of the specified complex number. tan(z) = sin(z)/cos(z).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
tan(z).

tanh

public static Complex tanh(Complex z)
The hyperbolic tangent of the specified complex number. tanh(z) = sinh(z)/cosh(z).

Parameters:
z - The complex number.
Returns:
tanh(z).

times

public static Complex times(Complex z,
                            Complex w)
Mutiplies two complex numbers. In other words, (x+i*y)*(s+i*t) = ((x*s-y*t), i*(x*t-y*s))

Parameters:
z - The first number to multiply.
w - The second number to multiply.

arg

public double arg()
The argument of the complex number (the angle from the real-axis in polar coordinates).

Returns:
arg(z) in radians, where z is the complex number.

clone

public Complex clone()
Creates a clone of this complex number; this method returns a different instance of the number, but with the same value.

in other words, for complex number x, the expression: x.clone() != x will be true, and that the expression: x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass() will be true. Also: x.clone().equals(x) will be true.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A new instance of the complex number.

equals

public boolean equals(Complex z)
Checks to see if the given complex number is equal to this complex number.

Parameters:
z - The complex number to which this one will be compared.
Returns:
true if the complex numbers are identical.

getImaginary

public double getImaginary()
The imaginary part of the complex number.

Returns:
Im[z] where z is the complex number.

getReal

public double getReal()
The real part of the complex number.

Returns:
Re[z] where z is the complex number.

magnitude

public double magnitude()
The magnitude (or modulus) of the complex number (the distance from the origin in polar coordinates).

Returns:
|z| where z is the complex number.

modulus

public double modulus()
The modulus of the complex number (the distance from the origin in polar coordinates).

Returns:
|z| where z is the complex number.

setImaginary

public void setImaginary(double imaginary)
Sets the imaginary part of the complex number.

Parameters:
imaginary - The imaginary part of a complex number.

setReal

public void setReal(double real)
Sets the real part of the complex number.

Parameters:
real - The real part of a complex number.

toPrettyString

public java.lang.String toPrettyString(int numberOfDecimalPlaces)
Returns the complex number as a string, but only uses the specified number of decimal places for the real and imaginary components. In other words, truncates the output of the real and imaginary components when constructing the string.

Parameters:
numberOfDecimalPlaces - The number of decimal places (between 1 and 32 inclusive) that will be used for the real and imaginary components of the number.
Returns:
"x + y i", "x - y i", "x", or "y i" as appropriate, but with x and y restricted to the specified number of decimal places.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
String representation of this complex number.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Will return one of "u + wi", "u - wi", "-u + wi", "-u - wi", "u", "-u", "wi",or "-wi" as appropriate. Note that the spaces will be exactly as indicated. The values of u and w may contain scientific notation such as 0.37E-5 which will not have any additional spaces.
